results.title: The daily business briefing: October 25, 2023 | The Week
results.content:
estimates of $23.49 billion, according to LSEG data. Azure revenue was up 29%, beating market research firm Visible Alpha's growth estimate of 26.2%. Microsoft shares were up 3.5%. Reuters [...] The three major stock indexes rose on Tuesday as several big companies, including Coca-Cola, General Electric and 3M, boosted their 2023 outlooks. The Dow Jones Industrial Average and the S&P 500 gained 0.6% and 0.7%, respectively. The tech-heavy Nasdaq Composite jumped 0.9%. Stock futures struggled early Wednesday. Dow futures were up 0.1% while those tied to the S&P 500 and the Nasdaq were down 0.3% and 0.6%, respectively, at 7 a.m. ET. More major companies report third quarter earnings [...] SUBSCRIBE & SAVE

Less than $3 per week

The daily business briefing: October 25, 2023

Dozens of states accuse Meta of making social media addictive, the UAW expands its strike to GM's biggest plant, and more

1. States sue Meta, saying its sites harm kids

results.title: Stock Market News for Oct 25, 2023 - Yahoo Finance
results.content:
The Coca-Cola Company's KO third-quarter 2023 top and bottom lines surpassed the Zacks Consensus Estimate. Earnings of 74 cents per share grew 7% from the year-ago period and beat the Zacks Consensus Estimate of 69 cents. Revenues of $11.9 billion surpassed the Zacks Consensus Estimate of $11.5 billion and improved 8% year over year. [...] The Dow Jones Industrial Average (DJI) rose 0.6% or 204.97 points to close at 33,141.38. Twenty-one components of the 30-stock index ended in positive territory, while nine ended in negative.

The tech-heavy Nasdaq Composite added 121.55 points or 0.9% to close at 13,139.88. [...] The S&P 500 gained 30.64 points, or 0.7%, to close at 4,247.68. Ten out of the 11 broad sectors of the benchmark index closed in the green. The Utilities Select Sector SPDR (XLU), the Real Estate Select Sector SPDR (XLRE) and the Materials Select Sector SPDR (XLB) advanced 2.6%, 1.3% and 1.2%, respectively, while the Energy Select Sector SPDR (XLE) declined 1.4%.

The fear-gauge CBOE Volatility Index (VIX) decreased 6.9% to 18.97.

Strong Earnings Numbers Help Drive Markets

results.title: Markets News, Oct. 25, 2023: Nasdaq Falls to 5-Month Low on ...
results.content:
Microsoft and Alphabet both beat analysts' estimates on the top and bottom lines, but the devil was in the details. Microsoft's cloud business grew 29% year-over-year, an acceleration from the second quarter and above expectations. Meanwhile, a rebound in Google's primary advertising business was overshadowed by slower-than-expected cloud growth.

Investors will be looking to earnings from Meta Platforms (META) and IBM (IBM) after the bell. [...] T-Mobile U.S. (TMUS) reported better-than-expected profit and boosted the low end of its guidance as the mobile phone provider added more customers than anticipated.

The third-largest U.S. wireless company posted third-quarter fiscal 2023 earnings per share (EPS) of $1.82, beating estimates. Revenue fell 1.2% from the same period a year ago to $19.25 billion, in line with forecasts. [...] Intel (INTC) plunged more than 5.1%, adding to losses suffered earlier in the week on reports Nvidia (NVDA) is developing a computer processing unit with Arm (ARM) designs, challenging Intel's core PC business.

Shares of Salesforce (CRM) declined 3.5%. The stock fell earlier in the week following a downgrade from Piper Sandler on concerns about over-optimistic AI business forecasts. Dow Inc. (DOW) shares fell 3.5% a day after its quarterly earning report revealed lower sales volumes.

messages.content:
Here are some key highlights from today's business news (October 25, 2023):

1. **Stock Market Performance**:
   - The three major stock indexes rose on Tuesday, with the Dow Jones Industrial Average gaining 0.6%, the S&P 500 up 0.7%, and the Nasdaq Composite increasing by 0.9%. 
   - Coca-Cola, General Electric, and 3M boosted their 2023 outlooks, contributing to the positive market sentiment.

2. **Earnings Reports**:
   - Coca-Cola reported earnings of 74 cents per share, exceeding estimates and showing a 7% growth year-over-year. Revenues reached $11.9 billion, surpassing expectations.
   - Microsoft and Alphabet both beat analysts' estimates, with Microsoft's cloud business growing 29% year-over-year.
   - T-Mobile U.S. reported better-than-expected profits and increased its guidance, while Intel shares fell over 5% due to competitive pressures.

3. **Legal Actions**:
   - Several states have filed a lawsuit against Meta, claiming that its social media platforms are harmful to children.

For more detailed information, you can check the full articles:
- [The Daily Business Briefing](https://theweek.com/business/the-daily-business-briefing-october-25-2023)
- [Yahoo Finance](https://finance.yahoo.com/news/stock-market-news-oct-25-133500074.html)
- [Investopedia](https://www.investopedia.com/dow-jones-today-10252023-8380208)
